desc: Can transaction fees support the network after the block subsidy reduces to negligible amounts?

msgs.text: Can transaction fees support the network after the block subsidy reduces to negligible amounts?

something people usually forget on this is that the cost of hash power is decreasing dramatically. so even though rewards can fall but so do expense for miners, so there's still profit to be made / incentive to mine.

Not quite. The security of the network isn't backed by total hashrate or electricity usage. It's backed by total value-cost of the security subsidy. It doesn't matter if hashrate cost decreases. It will decrease both for miners and attackers. What matters is the total value-cost of the hashrate being used. So if hashrate gets cheaper, to simply maintain the same level of security would mean an equal increase in total hashrate to equate to the same total value-cost of the total hashrate.
